intro: Goniothalamus repevensis, commonly known as the Malay mountain ash, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy surface. The fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that contains multiple seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
